body_html:
This issue should be safe to close, now that TF 1.5 is rolled out. To recap:

This problem wasn't easy to solve, due to challenging constraints imposed by vendors—who shall remain nameless.

What fixed this is @av8ramit @gunan @case540 (among others) are now putting aside added time to manually build CPU releases on Ubuntu 14.04, to maintain the compatibility commitments we made to the community.

An optional Debian 8 Clang 6.0 toolchain now also exists, but wasn't what solved this issue; however, it can provide flexibility for folks in the community needing to do compatible source builds—particularly ones that take advantage of recent instructions sets, e.g. AVX-512, on old distros with very recent hardware.

Please note I'm not sure what the status is for tf-nightly, which might not be Ubuntu 14 compatible.

An optional Debian 8 Clang 6.0 toolchain now also exists, but wasn't what solved this issue; however, it can provide flexibility for folks in the community needing to do compatible source builds—particularly ones that take advantage of recent instructions sets, e.g. AVX-512, on old distros with very recent hardware.
Please note I'm not sure what the status is for tf-nightly, which might not be Ubuntu 14 compatible.
body:
This issue should be safe to close, now that TF 1.5 is rolled out. To recap:

This problem wasn't easy to solve, due to challenging constraints imposed by vendors—who shall remain nameless.

What fixed this is @av8ramit @gunan @case540 (among others) are now putting aside added time to manually build CPU releases on Ubuntu 14.04, to maintain the compatibility commitments we made to the community.

An optional [Debian 8 Clang 6.0 toolchain](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/16173) now also exists, but wasn't what solved this issue; however, it can provide flexibility for folks in the community needing to do compatible source builds—particularly ones that take advantage of recent instructions sets, e.g. AVX-512, on old distros with very recent hardware.

Please note I'm not sure what the status is for tf-nightly, which might not be Ubuntu 14 compatible.
